ANSWER: Based on the diagnosis of chronic periodontitis with active bleeding, I recommend a comprehensive treatment approach that combines evidence-based medical management with patient-centered care strategies. The treatment plan includes initial periodontal therapy with scaling and root planing (SRP) alongside oral hygiene reinforcement and the adjunctive use of chlorhexidine mouth rinse. Careful assessment of bleeding risk and medication use will guide safe procedural planning. Pharmacological management focuses on local antimicrobial control, with possible systemic antibiotics if infection persists. Non-pharmacological strategies emphasize improving oral hygiene, patient education, and addressing medication effects. Follow-up is scheduled within 4 weeks to monitor clinical response, with ongoing evaluation and potential specialist referral if necessary. Clear communication and patient involvement are prioritized to enhance adherence and long-term periodontal stability. This approach aims to reduce inflammation, bleeding, and periodontal destruction while minimizing risks related to bleeding and systemic health issues.
